item.title: Experts say it is safe to use paracetamol during pregnancy and Trump's autism declaration is 'baseless'

item.title: Man accused of hitting 42yo with vehicle in Kalgoorlie appears in court
item.description: A 29-year-old man has faced court today after detectives from WA Police's Homicide Squad charged him with murder, two days after the death of a man in the state's Goldfields.

item.title: Man known as 'Moore Park Rapist' pleads guilty to series of sexual assaults in Sydney
item.description: Glenn Cameron has remained in custody since he was arrested in February last year and charged with more than 30 offences in relation to eight victims.

item.description: He's a prolific fixture on our screens who's famously six degrees from almost anyone. But Kevin Bacon is also a passionate musician and philanthropist.

item.title: Why many Palestinians are underwhelmed by countries like Australia only now recognising statehood
item.description: Australia joined nine other nations in formally recognising Palestinian statehood at the UN this week. But Palestinians have mixed feelings.

item.title: David Crisafulli stands by election commitments as mining companies criticise coal royalties in State of the State address
item.description: In his first State of the State address, Premier David Crisafulli says the government is "open for business", but not interested in companies that abandon Queenslanders in "the name of shareholder interests".

item.title: Vanuatu plans to sign police deal with China while Nakamal pact with Australia is left hanging
item.description: Vanuatu declares it will sign a new policing agreement with China as the landmark Nakamal pact between Australia and the Pacific Island nation hangs in the balance.

item.title: Sale of Australia's biggest sheep station at Rawlinna finally gets WA government approval
item.description: The WA government has finally signed off on the sale of Australia's largest sheep station almost seven months after UK-based Consolidated Pastoral Company announced plans to buy Rawlinna Station.

item.title: Andrew Hastie's spray at 'muppet', 'coward' Liberal colleagues after post bemoaning loss of Aussie car making
item.description: Senior Liberal Andrew Hastie has taken aim at colleagues who questioned a social media post where he bemoaned the loss of Australian car making, calling them "nameless cowards" and "muppets".

item.description: Calls to ban no-grounds evictions in WA are rejected despite a new report finding the state has the second-worst protections for renters in the nation.

item.description: Melbourne recall three big guns, led by star half Jahrome Hughes, as their NRL title hopes go on the line in Friday night's preliminary final against Cronulla.

item.description: COVID showed just how "fragile" our economic security is. As artificial intelligence potentially takes jobs from humans, a universal basic income might be a solution.

item.description: A leading figure in Australia's art world has criticised the Northern Territory government for considering splitting up the lease for a building designed as a major new art gallery, describing the plan as "pure madness".

item.description: NASA's first crewed flight in its Artemis program — a trip around the Moon and back — is on track for launch in April 2026 and could potentially be moved up to February, the space agency says.

item.title: Senate inquiry examines federal environment department's SA algal bloom response
item.description: Officials from the federal environment department say they were not aware of the impact of SA's algal bloom until the state government contacted them in May, two months after the bloom was first detected. Speaking at a senate inquiry, department officials say the federal environment minister was not formally briefed on the bloom until July.

item.title: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says
item.description: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.description: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Police launch fresh search of WA outback over Ray and Jennie Kehlet cold case
item.description: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

item.description: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

item.description: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

item.description: Alexa Leary's win in the final individual event of Wednesday night's action in Singapore bookended a golden night for Australia after Callum Simpson won gold in the first event of the evening.

item.title: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania from Maydena to Hobart
item.description: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

item.title: Who is Samoa's new prime minister, Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt?
item.description: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

item.title: Hundreds of new dust-related lung disease cases recorded in Queensland
item.description: Nearly 300 workers from mines and work sites have had cases of lung cancer, black lung and other illnesses recorded by the state's dust disease register in the space of 12 months.

item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.description: A Katanning school bus driver and local farmers are calling for urgent action to address a growing danger posed by wandering livestock on rural roads.

item.description: Nottingham Forest's long-awaited return to European competition ends 2-2 at Real Betis, with Igor Jesus's first-half double cancelling out by a late Antony strike.

item.description: All the contenders are hopefuls vying for ARIA Awards glory at the music industry's glitzy ceremony, taking place next month.

item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.description: The apology by Mette Frederiksen in Greenland’s capital, Nuuk, hopes to close a traumatic chapter in Greenland's history.

item.description: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Police investigating after woman's body found in the Hobart Rivulet by man walking dog
item.description: Police say they have notified the family of a woman aged in her 30s whose body was found in the Hobart Rivulet on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Russia helping China to prepare for potential invasion of Taiwan, defence think tank RUSI says
item.description: Leaked Russian documents analysed by a leading UK think tank suggest Russia is selling military equipment and technology to China that could help it prepare an airborne invasion of Taiwan.

item.title: Australia's climate target doesn't eclipse today's tough questions
item.description: As a nation, it's as if we're arguing about where to have a family holiday in 2035, and whether we fly economy or business. Meanwhile, nobody can agree on dinner tonight.

item.title: How Alliyah's community missed the signs of a female predator
item.description: Gender stereotypes "play a role" in allowing predators like Kellie Whiteside to fly under the radar, but that's not the whole story.

item.title: Geelong and Brisbane's AFL grand final meeting a clash of 21st-century titans 25 years in the making
item.description: When they meet at the MCG on Saturday afternoon, Geelong and Brisbane are bidding for more than just the 2025 premiership. For the two most dominant clubs of a generation, true greatness is at hand.

item.title: Indians in Australia continue to face racist abuse one month on from anti-immigration protests
item.description: Nearly a month after anti-immigration protests swept across Australia, some in the Indian diaspora say they are still facing racist abuse and constantly "looking over their shoulder".

item.title: Epstein files show flight with Prince Andrew and meetings with Elon Musk, Bill Gates
item.description: The documents include flight logs, massage messages and cash transactions in Jeffrey Epstein's ledger.

item.title: Gold Coast venue refuses entry to Māori man due to cultural tattoo
item.description: Caleb Pokai says he was banned from entering the Burleigh Pavilion while out dinner with friends due to his tā moko.

item.title: Sydney schoolboy explains his autism and ADHD to peers
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sydney student compares his autism to 'limited edition Lego' in uplifting viral speech
item.description: Twelve-year-old Leo is the talk of his community thanks to a speech he made for his school's public speaking competition where he opened up about his neurodiversity.

item.title: Man charged with performing Nazi salute at AFL semifinal was former political candidate with history of racist posts
item.description: An ABC investigation reveals Tylere Baker-Pearce, a former political candidate who has posted a selfie smiling outside Auschwitz, was the man charged with performing a Nazi salute at an AFL game.

item.title: The majority of Queensland councils are washing their hands of fluoridation under the watch of both sides of politics
item.description: Attacks by Queensland Opposition Leader Steven Miles against Premier David Crisafulli over fluoride this week are more than hard to swallow after another local government's decision to stop adding the mineral to its water supply, writes Janelle Miles.

item.title: Crocodile industry stakeholders urge Australian government to reform outdated code of practice
item.description: Thrust back into the international spotlight by the recent trial of Outback Wrangler star Matt Wright, questions are being raised about the Top End's lucrative crocodile industry and its outdated code of practice.

item.title: Retiring paramedic sounds alarm over plummeting job retention rate
item.description: Peter Maxwell and wife Rachel spent a combined 77 years as NSW paramedics, but they might be the last of a generation of lifers, with one in 20 leaving the workforce every year.

item.title: Persistent algae bloom causing political headaches as scientists are copping the flak
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

item.title: Nooramunga Land and Sea buys private islands to save them from development
item.description: For roughly the price of an inner-city apartment, conservationists have bought multiple small islands off the coast of Gippsland to protect their ecosystems and wildlife.

item.title: AI can't teach our kids to be curious and think critically
item.description: The AI dystopia might already be here but there are some things only humans can teach our children.

item.title: Detailed designs of new lyric theatre inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks revealed
item.description: Detailed designs show plans for the new 2,000-seat lyric theatre, inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks, which will host major musicals, ballets and operas.

item.title: Police locate 10yo boy missing in Victoria's north-west
item.description: A 10-year-old boy has been located safe and well, more than 15 hours after he was last seen near a campground in Victoria's north-west.

item.title: Is it worth moving to Tasmania for the cooler climate?
item.description: Each of these eight families left the mainland in search of Tasmania's cooler, milder climate. But with challenges like health care, transport and limited services, do they have any regrets over the decision?

item.title: Conservation notice issued for alleged native vegetation clearing at Chittering
item.description: Western Australia's environmental regulator has issued a property owner with a vegetation conservation notice for the alleged clearing of a significant amount of native trees.

item.title: What time is the 2025 AFL grand final? Here's how to watch and everything you need to know as Brisbane and Geelong clash
item.description: Wondering what time the AFL grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

item.title: Wool price soars as production crashes and Chinese demand lifts
item.description: Australian wool prices lifted sharply this week for a few reasons, including a shrinking amount of wool being produced.

item.title: Investigations underway after several Launceston General Hospital staff reported feeling nauseated and faint
item.description: Tasmania Police initially said the incident at the Launceston General Hospital was potentially a gas leak, but the Tasmania Fire Service later said it did not detect any gas.

item.title: Lachie Neale expected to start as sub for Brisbane against Geelong in the 2025 AFL grand final
item.description: Brisbane Lions captain Lachie Neale is likely to start as sub in today's grand final as he battles a calf injury.

item.title: UN sanctions 'unfair, unjust and illegal', says Iran's president
item.description: The UN Security Council rejects another last-ditch effort to delay the reimposition of sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program.

item.title: The banal, brutal life of traffic police in South West WA
item.description: As WA experiences its worst year for road deaths in over a decade, the ABC shadows two traffic officers as they try to stop the number climbing higher.

item.title: For four years, Yuna and Minu Jo lay in a suitcase in a New Zealand storage unit. Now they have justice
item.description: Minu and Yuna Jo's bodies lay in a storage unit for four years. They finally have justice after their mother was found guilty of their murders seven years after they were killed.

item.title: Gladstone Strollers walking group creates a village for postpartum mums
item.description: A Queensland mum desperate to have a positive postpartum experience when she had her second child found that just a few small steps were enough to make a huge difference.

item.title: Trump visit to Ryder Cup not enough to inspire Americans as Europe dominates day one
item.description: President Donald Trump visits on the opening day of the Ryder Cup, but it's the Europeans who dominate heading into day two.

item.title: WA teenager starts petition for shearing to be in Brisbane 2032 Olympics
item.description: We saw break dancing added to the Olympic program for the Paris Games, and now there is a push for shearing to be included for the Brisbane Olympics in 2032.

item.title: AFL grand final 2025: Brisbane Lions thump Geelong Cats by 47 points, Will Ashcroft wins Norm Smith Medal
item.description: Brisbane secures its second straight AFL premiership, taking control in the final quarter of an otherwise gripping grand final against Geelong.

item.title: Fortescue offers measles vaccine boosters after Christmas Creek outbreak
item.description: Iron-ore giant Fortescue says it will offer vaccine boosters after three measles cases were confirmed at its Pilbara mine earlier this month.

item.title: Tourist dies at Tasmania's Cradle Mountain National Park after group becomes 'overwhelmed' by extreme weather
item.description: A group of tourists who were unprepared for the extreme conditions at Cradle Mountain National Park is rescued, but one member of the group dies.

item.title: Cyclist on a gruelling journey to fight for a better future for people with dementia
item.description: Nicholas Tremaine is cycling more than 40,000 kilometres to raise $1 million to fight the condition that's befallen his mother and is now Australia's leading cause of death.

item.title: WA government facing $400m cost blowout over Peel Health Campus redevelopment
item.description: The long-awaited redevelopment of Peel Health Campus is facing a $400 million cost blowout and potential delays, a leaked document reveals.

item.title: Snoop Dogg, Baker Boy and Tash Sultana star in AFL grand final entertainment
item.description: The legendary rapper delivered a squeaky clean performance, incorporating local artists and a didgeridoo in a trip through his catalogue.

item.title: Matt Wright's lawyers reveal five grounds of appeal for Netflix star's guilty verdict, including allegation against judge
item.description: Matt Wright's lawyers have revealed the five grounds they are seeking to appeal their client's guilty verdict on, including an allegation that the judge made an "impermissible comment to the jury".

item.title: Lions star Will Ashcroft wins second consecutive Norm Smith Medal
item.description: Will Ashcroft claims back-to-back Norm Smith Medals after playing a starring role in the Brisbane Lions' grand final win over Geelong.

item.title: How the internet reacted to the Brisbane Lions winning the AFL grand final
item.description: Brisbane completed an historic back-to-back premiership, beating a wounded Geelong at the MCG, and the internet followed along with every kick.

item.title: Shark victim Mercury Psillakis's twin brother leads paddle out on Sydney's Northern Beaches
item.description: The twin brother of shark victim Mercury Psillakis has led hundreds of surfers in a paddle out in his memory on Sydney's Northern Beaches.

item.title: AFL grand final quick hits: Lions' Lachie Neale gamble pays off, Cats' Jeremy Cameron in the wars, and it's Country Road time at the MCG
item.description: Brisbane's gamble on Lachie Neale's fitness pays off with a team-lifting goal, a brave Jeremy Cameron has a painful day out, and Charlie Cameron's goals provide a Country Road soundtrack at the MCG. Here are the quick hits from the 2025 AFL grand final.

item.title: White House releases photo of Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese
item.description: A photo of a smiling Donald Trump, alongside Anthony Albanese, his fiancée Jodie Haydon and US First Lady Melania Trump, has been released by the White House.

item.title: When it comes to love, more of us are crossing the religious divide
item.description: Exclusive data for 5.2 million couples shows nearly one in five marriages are between people of different religions – double the proportion recorded in 1986.

item.title: Donald Trump will send troops to 'war-ravaged' Portland, in latest deployment to US cities
item.description: The military says it is ready to mobilise as Donald Trump authorises "full force" to protect federal immigration facilities from "domestic terrorists".

item.title: Guy Sebastian reflects on Titus Day legal case and the lesson he's learned from fans
item.description: Guy Sebastian opens up about the fan encounter that made him "burst into tears" and a court case with his former manager, Titus Day.

item.title: Roosters on cusp of perfect NRLW season after beating Sharks 17-16
item.description: Jocelyn Kelleher is relishing the chance to prove her credentials as the Sydney Roosters look to claim back-to-back premierships for the first time in their history.

item.title: Woppaburra people welcome ancestor's return but face final hurdle
item.description: More First Nations remains are being returned to Australia from international institutions, but these Woppaburra men say laying them to rest on country can prove a fresh challenge.

item.title: England defeats Canada 33-13 in Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: In front of a record crowd of more than 80,000 spectators, England delivers on the biggest stage with a 33-13 defeat of Canada in the tournament decider at Twickenham.

item.title: Queensland's coal royalty regime back in the spotlight after job cuts
item.description: Despite a change of government, Queensland's controversial coal royalty scheme remains in place and recent job cuts are prompting renewed discussion about it.

item.title: Sydney stomping grounds of 1920s and 30s crime bosses
item.description: From the "queen of the underworld" to a razor gang slasher in control of an underworld empire, these were the bosses at the centre of an organised crime battle in the late 20s and early 30s.

item.title: Brisbane and Geelong fans experience the ecstasy and agony of AFL's biggest game
item.description: For the second year in a row, Brisbane Lions fans were celebrating in the streets as their team claimed the premiership.

item.title: Bowie Daly, 9, makes surfing comeback after surviving shark attack
item.description: Bowie Daly may be back in the surf but he says the near miss still plays on his mind.

item.title: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov warns NATO, Europe that aggression will be met with a 'decisive response'
item.description: While Russia does not intend to attack Europe, its Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has not ruled out action against NATO aggression.

item.title: Fifty years on, Rocky Horror Picture Show proves weird never goes out of style
item.description: The Rocky Horror Picture Show film still screens in cinemas around the world, captivating a new generation of cinemagoers.

item.title: Lions AFL coach Chris Fagan vindicated with Lachie Neale sub call in grand final win over Cats
item.description: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan admits he took a punt by naming Lachie Neale as the sub ahead of their stunning win over Geelong in the grand final.

item.title: Rod Barwick has international fame as a daffodil breeder, but what matters to him is a love of gardening
item.description: Rod Barwick planted his first daffodil bulbs in the 1970s. Within a few years he was breeding daffodils and has been recognised internationally for his work, but he says enjoying growing plants is the most important part of gardening.

item.title: Jindabyne residents priced out as short-term accommodation booms
item.description: Jindabyne is grappling with how to capitalise on its winter tourism influx while ensuring long-term residents can continue to afford to live there.

item.title: Lavrov warns of 'decisive response' to aggression against Russia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia finishes World Para Swimming Championships with relay gold
item.description: Australia claims its ninth gold medal at the World Para Swimming Championships on the final day of competition in Singapore.

item.title: Thirty years ago, Oasis made (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — a Britpop blockbuster
item.description: They'll soon tour Australia, but 30 years ago, Oasis were about to release (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — an enduring British rock classic. Here's how they did it.

item.title: Moment Brisbane Lions win 2025 AFL premiership
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ten-year-old mini bull rider from Cape York takes on world's best in Utah
item.description: In a huge dark hat and shining belt buckle, a 10-year-old from Cape York proves he can mix it with the best at the world finals in Utah.

item.title: Calls for fresh probe into Yolŋu leader's mysterious disappearance
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda's family in calls for fresh probe into mystery disappearance
item.description: The family of vanished Yolŋu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.
